Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2012 06:51PM almostdone wrote: I was diagnosed in 2006 and am writing my first post, and frankly I feel I should not be asking, for in comparison to most I have had a very easy time.  I was stage 2, bilateral mastectomy, chemo and due to a blood disorder I could not go on tamoxifin.  They put me on Zolodex injections and Arimidex.  After 9 months I decided I'd rather live a shorter life than continue with the Arimidex, so I stopped it and just did the Zolodex.  I've had 57 injections with that NAIL of a needle and had side effects - fatigue, foggy head, low libido, high blood pressure,  weight gain, hot flashes, hot flashes, hot flashes and major mood swings - so now on Welbutrin.  I was to have 60 of the injections, once a month.  I missed one a couple of years ago, and I missed on in January, so now I'm to finish in June instead of May.  When I missed in January I noticed I felt better.  Here are my questions:  Can anyone convince me to skip the last two - I'm sick of getting them!  Question Two:  Will I get back to normal?  Will I be able to think again, lose weight and wake up early in the morning again?  Does anyone know?  I know I'm almost there to get the answer myself, but I just want to know. Sending a hug to my sisters and brothers and wishing you all good health, Almost Done
Posts.Title: Femara, Zolodex or Zometa Side effects??? smiley2 Naniam

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2012 06:21AM almostdone wrote: I have had 57 injections. I don't know anymore how high, because I am on metoprolol. I was on a diuretic as well but I stopped it for I was always running to a bathroom. I guess that is why my ankles are swollen and perhaps why I probably wake up with headaches often, ie today. But with all that said I am almost done. And it is better than arimidex so hang in there. Give yourself a party whenever you want to stop. After 57 I want to stop, so I am planning my big bash. If it were not for this forum I think I would have stopped. So thank you everyone and I will toast you all at my party. Have a sweet day! Almost done
